narrative.title: Xiii Corps - 1942Q4
narrative.situation: British Corps (Mixed Infantry and Armoured) deployed in North Africa during 1942Q4.
narrative.objectives: Southern sector holding force and mobile reserve. Montgomery's plan assigned XIII Corps the mission of conducting diversionary attacks to fix Axis armoured forces in the south, preventing their redeployment to counter XXX Corps breakthrough in the north. 7th Armoured Division held as mobile reserve for 'destructive pursuit' of retreating Axis forces after breakthrough achieved.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Southern sector: rocky desert plateau and soft sand (Qattara Depression to south - impassable). Terrain favors defense over offense. Limited trafficable routes for armor. Pursuit phase (November-December): coastal plain and rocky desert across Libya.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Experienced desert warfare formations (7th Armoured, 50th Infantry)
Multinational cooperation (British, Free French, Greek units)
